metadata.title: CVE-2016-7167 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
Multiple integer overflows in the (1) curl_escape, (2) curl_easy_escape,(3) curl_unescape, and (4) curl_easy_unescape functions in libcurl before7.50.3 allow attackers to have unspecified impact via a string of length0xffffffff, which triggers a heap-based buffer overflow.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7167` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

curl - 7.47.0-1ubuntu2.2
libcurl3 - 7.47.0-1ubuntu2.2
libcurl3-gnutls - 7.47.0-1ubuntu2.2
libcurl3-nss - 7.47.0-1ubuntu2.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: curl package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.47.0-1ubuntu2.2').
